column1: Hey, Dwight, I dont know if you heard, but were supposed to be drinking out of weird backpacks instead of cups, like regular people.  Oh, you did hear.
Wow, thats a lot of keys.
Thats right. The janitor said that. By the way, the raccoons are back.
I think they run through these panels and then down under the map. I wouldnt know for sure cause I dont have a trained ear. Thats why I have to use one of these.
Yep. Wait, and this.
Go get em.
What happened to me this summer? Dwight bought the building, so actually, this has been the busiest summer of my life.
Oh, no. Dont worry about it. I was just gonna put a couple keys on it every day until Christmas. Then his pants would have fallen down, which was a little gift to me, but...
Well, it would have been. So unprofessional, Mrs. Halpert.
Oh, man, so many points being made.
But youre comparing you and Luke to God and Jesus.
You really think you can make it up to me with food?
Yep. Thats exactly what my first thought was. And then I remembered having a conversation with him where he was like, "I dont own an Ebay store," so...
You follow him on Twitter?
Pam?
I did not do this.
This is impressive.
Do they call you that?
Come on, give me your hand. Ill help you down.
Oh! Of course there is. Hey, Chinese tonight?
Great.
Pretty good. You must be almost out of water.
Is there really?
Aaah!

Oh... lets take the tour Pam.

Who will be watching the children?

Were going to head outside, give it a whirl. I just want to see how it works.
But Ill tell you this, if this works out, I think were looking real good.

Pam?
Everything is going to be ok.
Youre good... youre good at sales.

Ok.
Wait, wait, wait. Thats actually a really good idea Kelly.
Dwight, how about this? Instead of boycotting, you and I, together, go down to that store and we teach those snobs a lesson.
Alright.
No, no. I want to hear you tell it.
Before me stands your coworker, Dwight Kurt Schrute. Dwight, show them all sides. Turn around. Now, today, we need your help turning Dwight into a gentleman.
No, this is instead of the boycott. Yeah?
Agreed.
We present to you for your comments and approval, Dwight K. Shrute.
Wish us luck!
Is that what you were here for? A crystal wizard? I like it.
Wait a second. You know you cant buy that now, right? And I can come back and get it for you later. But Im saying right now, we cant do that.
Thats it.
Stop, stop, stop.
Did you just say you remember him?
What does that mean?
Lets just go.
There it is. Alright.
Thats pretty good.
Yes!
Its my own fault-
Really?
For a lot of reasons.
You should actually thank Erin, shes the one who agreed to babysit.
Everythings fine.
We can relax. Lets get our Sweeney on.
Okay, I think everybody just needs to relax.
Oh, my God.
Okay, this was pretty simple-
Really, all you had to do was play with her for, like, 30 minutes and then put her to bed.
Well, the car seat was to take her to the hospital, or...
No, were good. Thank you, though.
Alright, well, were never leaving the house again.
Its like The Hurt Locker!
No, it was not a disaster. It was weird, but it wasnt a disaster. I think we have, like, a gift bottle of Irish cream.
We could put that in orange juice.
Yeah?
Yeah!
That was like, ten years ago.
Nope, its because its genitalia.
Am I blocking anybody? Can everybody see?
Good!
Are you sure you once knew how to do this?
Just steer more now.
No! No!
Amazing. How do I look?
Well, I do the best with what Ive got. Lets go.
Hes not the Steve Nash. Hes big though. Hes kind of like...Scrantons Steve Nash.
Im not doing that. Im just explaining.
Phoenix Suns point guard?

Well, Im neither of those things, so...
Oh, ha ha ha. Dwight...
Well, by worst, you mean the best.
So, the situation is the worst.
No, he didnt.
Tell em.
What? He never called you? I thought you said it just fizzled.
Yeah, I thought you started it.
Ahhh.
Okay, great-
-Im just gonna watch.

Hey, its Jim. Listen, this is important. Are you busy?
Listen, you gotta get over here, cause were pitching Steve Nash and Danny Cordray is here.

Showtime!

Is that your office?
A what?
I think you mean The Sting.

Meredith was the perfect choice to play the head of the company. Her lunch break lined up with our appointment with Danny and...thats it. Thats really all we were looking for.
Meredith Van Helsing?
Okay. But what is he more famous for?
You know this isnt real TV, right?
Okay, hes not that good-looking. I dont understand why everybodys obsessed with this-

Will you stop? Stop it, stop it. Heres the story-they need Meredith somewhere else asap, okay?
So youre taking over. You just gotta get her out of there as soon as you can.
Yes.
Exactly. You can do this.
Stop it! Its gonna be great.
And listen if anything else happens, just...roll with it.

Great. Sounds awesome. Just have him pitch to you.
No, no, no, no...

Did ya?
Im just kidding. She told me about it.
Oh.
Dwight, please.
Hey, crazy, um...so...thats it? Youre just-youre fine?
I dont know.  Oh! Thats... not... yours.
Stanley just drank OJ out of my mug, and didnt seem to realize that it wasnt his hot coffee. So the question has to be asked, is there no limit to what he wont notice?
Stop.
Sounds like someones really trying to convince us that hes not the Scranton Strangler.
I am Popeye!
Ive never really been a costume guy. Even when I was a kid, it just felt like something I was too old for. And then this morning, when Pam hands me this little number  ...no.

So four years ago, when I was in Stamford, Connecticut, and dating someone else, Pam went on two dates with Danny. Which was obviously the greatest love story ever told, given how much people are walking on eggshells around us.
Thats right.
Yikes.
Oh, no.
No. No, Im not gonna-no.

Oooh! You cant handle the truth!
We have one question to ask the spirit world and you want us to ask that?
Hey.
When you work hard, you play hard around here.  Even if you dont work hard. Oh, heres something. Uh, why didnt you ever call Pam back?
Yeah. I mean, Im not saying that everyone has to fall in love, or anything, Im just saying... but you know, to not even call her back is...
Could be. But you also called her the second time so you had the number right.
Nope.
Just tell her the real reason.
Hey. She had a nice time. It seems rude.
Hey, man.
To be honest, I still cant believe he didnt call her back. Who doesnt call a dork like that back?
Spinach in a can. Power eat spinach.

Big day.

It is really funny, but you know that can be confusing at a christening because you are not the godfather.

Right now?
Okay. All right, come on.  Where are we going? Where are we going? Were gonna take a little field trip.
Okay. Okay. Theres my girl. All right. Hold on one second. There we go. Whats that face for? Oh, my-oh, my God. Cece, no. No, no, no, not on the dress! Cece, stop!

Yeah.
Huh, you think she is jealous about having a baby?
Okay, well, you know what? Everybodys hungry.  Sorry. I think Im just hungry.

All right. And cider.

Uh, MeeMaw, wheres Cece?
Okay.
Hey, guys, has anybody seen the baby?
I dont know, dad. I dont know.
I dont know. Hey, have you seen my baby?
A small blonde woman?
Uh, everyone? Everyone, can I just have your attention? Has anyone seen a small- Stop that tiny blonde woman! She stole my baby!
Hi.
Hi.  All right. Travel safe, Angela.
Whats that? Oh, yeah, back then I did. Just now. So, dont, because Ive got my eye on you.
Yeah. Yeah, a little bit. I did.

Okay?
You play?

Okay...
Hey.
I dont know about, love...

Okay...
You need to stop talking.
Okay...
Im going home, and Im taking my baby with me.
Im not gonna-

Im trying everything.
Thats--  the password. Were in.
All right, Thank you, I will--I will send the contracts over right away. All Right.  Whoo!

I am on the first hot sale streak of my life. I think it all comes from feeding Cece, because no matter how much she resists, I sell her those carrots. Lets be honest--if I can make mushed carrots seem better than a boob... I can pretty much sell anything.
Mm-Kay, Well, it cant be zero, Kev.
What are you talking about? We--we have a commission cap?
A commission cap takes away my incentive to sell. So you realize I now have no reason to work, right?
Nope.
Okay.

Pam. Okay, now Ive tried everything.

Oh, nice, wasting time, here we go.
Talk to me.

Which is you.
I disagree with.

Oh wow, these are nice.

Woah, there is a lot of brainpower in this room. Weve got Michael and Oscar, the two smartest guys in the office, also in that order.

Around here, Oscar is known as actually because he will insert himself into just about any conversation to add facts, or correct grammar. He really does fit that old stereotype of the smug gay Mexican.

Hes trying to set you up Michael. Whats going to happen is hes going to try and bring up what ever youre talking about in a very casual way, but secretly hell be trying to trip you up, and when he does, boom, its awful. Havent you noticed that I dont bring up the Tour de France around him?

Hes a jerk.

I was in Jamaica, and I got lost, and it was getting dark this one night and then out of nowhere with a cart and hes selling these. Dwight hes telling me things about myself that theres no way he could have known.

So Ive been meaning to tell ya, I wanna take you out for lunch. For your last day.
What do you think? Tomorrow? Lunch, you and me?
Youre not leaving tomorrow. Youre leaving today right?
Wow, so thats it huh? Just, four oclock and you are gone for good.

And then tomorrow, I can tell you... what a great boss, you turned out to be. The best boss I ever had.
Alright.

I will see you, tomorrow at lunch.

If its alright, can I just have like one minute alone, just to go over --

So as it turns out, unless youre a young child or a prison inmate, you dont need anyone supervising you. People just come in and do their work on their schedule. Imagine that - people like us allowed to sell paper. Unsupervised.  And yet, somehow it works. It must be because the stakes are so high.

Well, I really appreciate the offer, but Im just happy the way things are. Okay. Thank you.  That was Jo, asking me if I wanted to take over as acting manager while they find a replacement. I told her... I dont want to mess this up, right? Theres a consensus, people are happy.
Wait...
Im coming.
Youd slow me down.

Dwight has been acting manager for three months now. No. A week. Just feels like three months. Lets see, we all have to punch in to a time clock, which is very old, very strong, and has a slot about the size of a finger.  We were all given new business cards big enough to set us apart from the competition, which is how I learned that our titles are all now Junior Employee. Our lunch breaks are staggered to prevent wasting time. Mines at 1030, and I find that the first hour of the day goes by a lot quicker than the second seven hours.
Question, if we already fomented insurrection, may we be grandfathered in?
You define foment.
Oh, its just a social club. You know, like the French Revolution, or the Black Panthers, or communism. Its just a club. Guys talking, you know.
Nope. Social club. God, I hate when everybody calls us a rebellion.
And we would love to have you. But not today. Unfortunately, its a bad day, what with Operation Overthrow and everything, but I have noted it.
Wow, youve really embraced the whole Bond villain aesthetic.
And the desk.
Okay.
I promise...d other people that I would be on my worst behavior. And I gave them my word, so...
